title: 109_hr5118
content: The Act may be cited as the "Medicare Rural Health Provider Payment Extension Act of 2006". The "Medicare Rural Health Provider Payment Extension Act of 2006" includes extensions for various Medicare provisions such as hospital outpatient services, physician incentive programs, ground ambulance services, work geographic adjustments, clinical laboratory tests, and home health services in rural areas. The Medicare Rural Health Provider Payment Extension Act of 2006 extends the Medicare rural hospital hold harmless provision for hospital outpatient services until 2010 and the Medicare incentive payment program for physician scarcity areas until 2011. Extension of Medicare increase payments for ground ambulance services in rural areas. Extension of Medicare increase payments for ground ambulance services in rural areas. Section 1834(l)(13) of the Social Security Act is amended to adjust payment provisions for services provided between specific dates. The text chunk amends payment provisions for ground ambulance services in rural areas by adjusting specific dates. SEC. 5 amends the Medicare work geographic adjustment floor to extend until 2011. SEC. 6 extends Medicare reasonable costs payments for clinical diagnostic laboratory tests in rural areas to 7 years. SEC. 7 extends temporary Medicare payment increase for home health services in rural areas. Section 421 of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 is amended to extend the temporary payment increase for home health services until December 31, 2011. Lump sum payments will be provided for home health services furnished before the date of enactment of this Act. The amendment provides for a lump sum payment within 60 days of enactment for amounts due. The effective date is April 1, 2005 for episodes and visits.
